summary: The Maritime Supply Chain Security Act (H.R. 2390) aims to amend Title 46 of the United States Code to address security concerns within the maritime supply chain. The bill specifically allows port infrastructure development program funds to be used to replace Chinese-made port crane hardware or software. This is to address potential security risks associated with Chinese-provided technology within U.S. ports, bolstering port resilience.  The bill was introduced in the House of Representatives on March 26, 2025.
